meanings.definition: A process in which a reaction is catalyzed by one of its products.
meanings.sent1: Autocatalysis is when a reaction is sped up by one of its own products.
meanings.sent2: The autocatalysis of a reaction can lead to faster chemical changes.
meanings.sent3: The scientist joked that the reaction was so lazy, it needed autocatalysis to get moving.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm acted as an autocatalysis, sparking creativity in the team.
meanings.sent5: The concept of autocatalysis is like a domino effect within a chemical reaction.

meanings.definition: The catalysis of a reaction by one of its products.
meanings.sent1: Autocatalysis occurs when a product speeds up a reaction.
meanings.sent2: Chemists study autocatalysis to understand how reactions can be self-propelling.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen experiment unexpectedly turned into a lesson on autocatalysis.
meanings.sent4: His encouragement acted as an autocatalysis, driving her to achieve more.
meanings.sent5: The idea of autocatalysis is like a helpful push from within a chemical process.
